comments.body: Why opening the shell on the constructor and not opening it on the 'open_shell' method?

`open_shell` is a dummy command to start `ansible-connection`
`ansible-connection` is refactored to remove this dependency.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +89,93 @@        display.display('ssh connection done, setting terminal', log_only=True)

        self._shell = self.ssh.invoke_shell()
        self._shell.settimeout(self._play_context.timeout)

comments.body: should this perhaps be part of `ConnectionBase` as an noop method?
I'm not sure this makes sense as a method for any other connection plugins, at least not while the method expects a unicode string of a pickled PlayContext object, rather than the object itself.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +137,141 @@        return self._local.fetch_file(in_path, out_path)

    def update_play_context(self, pc_data):
        """Updates the play context information for the connection"""
        pc_data = to_bytes(pc_data)

@@ -1,1 +260,264 @@    description:
      - Number of attempts to connect to remote host. The delay time between the retires increases after
        every attempt by power of 2 in seconds till either the maximum attempts are exhausted or any of the
